Director will have some ideas too, but we should have
cleared our own thinking before even looking for a man*
5) Have you seen that material corning out of Mich. State,
the AGRISEARCH papers? Are we thinking in terms of this
sort of material* If so, how can we avoid duplication?
How may we cooperate, if they want to?
6) What are we facing in trying to fill the position of the
Director? Granted he should have all of the virtues of
the President of Harvard, Harry Skoraia, and Burton Paulu,
rolled into one, but a) are we to look for him, b) or is
this being presumptuous and a matter of Hqs. doing it?
As 1 have previously pointed out I hope we aren't thinking
in terms of the average faculty salary for this position*
If he is to move to Urbana we should think in terms of
making it worthwhile enough to attract only the best in
this field. Then, too, it goes without saying that the position
calls for a man who intends to stay with it for at least
five years, perhaps ten or more*
7) Are we to start thinking that this position should be filled
by July 1, perhaps Sept. 1 at the latest?
The more questions I keep thinking about the more I am wondering if Hqs.
won't approve a meeting for us at Columbus this spring? Perhaps you
have already checked on this, but if we can't get together then, what
do you suggest?
A happy Easter to you and the family.
Cordially,
Raymond D. Cheydleur
Assistant Director
